action.name: Ice Breathe (Recharge 6)
text: Area Attack. automatic hit, range 20 ft. cone, creatures in range. Hit: 11 (2d10) cold damage, or half damage with a successful DC 11 Dexterity saving throw.

monster.spells: fear, sleep

action.name: Multiattack
text: A brine sea serpent attacks once with its tail and either bites or uses its brine blast.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must make a successful DC 17 Strength saving throw or be grappled and restrained. If the target of this attack is already grappled by the sea serpent, the attack hits automatically but the target repeats the saving throw, escaping from the grapple and restraint if the save succeeds. A brine serpent can have one creature grappled at a time.

action.name: Tail Slap
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the sea serpent.

action.name: Brine Blast (1/day)
text: Area Attack: automatic hit, range 50-ft. cone, creatures in cone. Hit: 45 (10d8) acid damage, or half damage with a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Coiling Maneuver
text: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: the target must make a successful DC 16 Strength saving throw or be grappled and restrained by the sea serpent. A brine serpent can have one creature grappled at a time.

action.name: Concentrate Brine
text: The sea serpent can try to recharge its brine blast attack. Roll 1d6; the attack recharges on a roll of 5 or 6.

action.name: Tail Attack
text: The sea serpent uses its tail attack against a target within reach.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A deep hunter attacks once with its tail and either bites or uses its swallow attack.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage, and the target must make a successful DC 18 Strength saving throw or be grappled and restrained. If the target of this attack is already grappled by the sea serpent, the attack hits automatically but the target repeats the saving throw; if the save succeeds, the target escapes from the grapple and restraint, but if the save fails, the target is swallowed (see above). A deep hunter can have up to two creatures grappled at a time.

action.name: Swallow (Recharge 5-6)
text: Melee Attack: automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one creature grappled by the deep hunter. Hit: the target must make a successful DC 18 Strength saving throw or be swallowed. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained. It takes 18 (2d12 +5) piercing damage immediately, and another 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage plus 2d8 acid damage automatically at the start of each of the sea serpents turns. Up to two Large creatures and any number of smaller creatures can be inside the deep hunter at one time. A swallowed creature is unaffected by anything happening outside the deep hunter or by attacks from outside it. A swallowed creature can get out of the deep hunter by using 15 feet of movement, but only after the sea serpent is dead.

action.name: Tail Slap
text: Melee Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the sea serpent.

action.name: Coiling Maneuver
text: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: the target must make a successful DC 18 Strength saving throw or be grappled and restrained by the sea serpent. A deep hunter can have up to two creatures grappled at a time.

action.name: Unhinge Jaw
text: The sea serpent can try to recharge its swallow attack. Roll 1d6; the attack recharges on a roll of 5 or 6.

action.name: Tail Attack
text: The sea serpent uses its tail attack against a target within reach.

trait.name: Impale
text: When a fanged sea serpent delivers a critical hit, it drives its fangs completely through the creatures body or limbs. An impaled creature is grappled and takes 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage at the start of each of the fanged sea serpents turns. It also takes 6 (1d12) piercing damage when it escapes from the grapple. A fanged sea serpent can have up to one Medium or two Small creatures impaled at one time.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. The target must make a successful DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1d4 rounds. The fanged sea serpent scores a critical hit if its attack roll is a natural 18, 19, or 20; see Impale, above.

monster.name: Shipbreaker Sea Serpent
monster.languages: Understands Aquan and Draconic but seldom speaks

action.name: Multiattack
text: A shipbreaker can bite once, attack with its tail, and ram a ship (if its ram attack is available).

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage, and the target must make a successful DC 22 Strength saving throw or be grappled and restrained. A ship breakercan have up to two creatures grappled at a time. This attack scores a critical hit if the attack roll is a natural 19 or 20.

action.name: Tail Slap
text: Melee Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 20 feet away from the sea serpent.

action.name: Ram (Recharge 6)
text: Melee Attack: automatic hit, one ship. Hit: the vessel makes a Hull saving throw, using the most appropriate DC from the table below, based on the ships type. The vessel sinks when it has failed the listed number of saving throws. The proficiency bonus of the ships captain can be added to the saving throw.
Ship Type Hull DC Sinks after
Rowboat 20 1 failed save
Barge 19 1 failed save
Oared Galley, small 18 2 failed saves
Oared Galley, large 16 2 failed saves
Sailing Merchant, small 17 2 failed saves
Sailing Merchant, large 15 3 failed saves
Sailing Warship 13 3 failed saves

action.name: Coiling Maneuver
text: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: the target must make a successful DC 22 Strength saving throw or be grappled and restrained by the sea serpent. Its Coming Round!. The shipbreaker can try to recharge its ram attack. Roll 1d6; the attack recharges on a roll of 5 or 6.

action.name: Tail Attack
text: The sea serpent uses its tail attack against a target within reach.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A spitting sea serpent spits once and bites once, or it can make a constrict attack.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage and the target must make a successful DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d8) poison damage.

action.name: Spit
text: Ranged Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) acid damage. This attack functions underwater with no penalty.

action.name: Constrict
text: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. Hit: the target must make a successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled and restrained and take 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Earth Glide
text: The igniguana can move through any sort of earth or mineral except metal as easily as a fish swims through water. This movement leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create any ripple or other sign of the igniguana's presence. It provokes an opportunity attack if it leaves a creature's reach while on the surface, but not if it does so while gliding through solid earth. The igniguana can't breathe while surrounded by solid stone or earth, so it can remain underground only for as long as it can hold its breath (15 minutes).

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 4-6)
text: Area Attack: automatic hit, range 20 ft. cone, creatures in cone. Hit: 9 (2d8) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw.

monster.name: Magmoid
monster.resist: bludgeoning, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: All-Around Awareness
text: A magmoid "sees" perfectly in all directions. Attackers never gain tactical advantage or bonus damage against it from the presence of nearby allies.

trait.name: Magma Body
text: Every time a magmoid is struck by a melee weapon, the weapon's wielder must make a successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or the weapon is destroyed by the heat of the magmoid's body. Magical weapons and bludgeoning weapons have tactical advantage on the saving throw, piercing weapons have tactical disadvantage, and magical piercing weapons have neither advantage nor disadvantage. Missiles are destroyed automatically. Creatures that attack a magmoid unarmed or with natural weapons take 4 (1d8) fire damage each time one of their attacks hits.

action.name: Slam
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage, and the creature takes 4 (1d8) fire damage at the start of its next turn.

action.name: Magma Blast (Recharge 5-6)
text: Area Attackast: automatic hit, range 40 ft. line, creatures in line. Hit: Each target must make a successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 11 (2d8 + 2) fire damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage at the start of its turn for 1d3 turns.

monster.name: Sandling
monster.resist: piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Vulnerability to Water
text: A sandling that is hit by at least two gallons of water has its speed halved, its AC reduced by 2, and it cant use reactions for one round.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Lava Weird
monster.resist: piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Control Elemental
text: Lava weirds have the ability to dominate elementals of the earth or fire type. When the lava weird uses an action to issue a command to an elemental within 50 feet, the elemental must make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be dominated. The effect is permanent, but the elemental is allowed to repeat the saving throw if it is commanded to do something that will clearly result in its own destruction. An elemental that makes a successful save is not dominated and is immune to this effect for 24 hours. Theres no limit to the number of elementals a lava weird can control. Once domination is established, it has no range limitation, provided the lava weird and the elemental remain on the same plane of existence. Lava weirds are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Lava Pool
text: A creature thats dragged into a lava pool (or that falls in, or winds up in lava for any reason at all) is restrained and takes 9 (2d8) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. To escape from the lava, the creature or an adjacent ally must use an action and make a successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check. If the check succeeds, the creature moves 5 feet out of the lava pool, is prone, and is on fire. While on fire, the creature takes 4 (1d8) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The fire is extinguished automatically when the creature or an adjacent ally spends an action to put it out.

trait.name: Reform
text: When reduced to 0 hit points, a lava weird dissolves into its lava pool. One minute later, it reforms with full hit points minus any hit points it lost to cold damage in the preceding 24 hours.

trait.name: Camouflage
text: Until it attacks, a lava weird in its lava pool is treated as invisible.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit (reach 5 ft.; one creature). Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) fire damage and the target must make a successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled. A grappled creature takes 6 (1d8 + 2) fire damage at the start of its turn. If the save succeeds, the target is not grappled but it does catch fire if it is wearing or carrying combustible material or is itself flammable. While the fire burns, the creature takes 4 (1d8) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The fire is extinguished automatically when the creature or an adjacent ally spends an action to put it out.

action.name: Drag Into Lava
text: Melee Attack: automatic hit, one creature grappled by the lava weird. Hit: the lava weird and the grappled creature engage in a Strength (Athletics) contest. If the lava weird wins, the grappled creature is dragged into the lava pool; see Lava Pool above.

monster.name: Fyr
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Resilient
text: A fyr has tactical advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A fyr's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). A fyr doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: animal friendship, speak with animals
3/day each: faerie fire, pass without trace
2/day each: beast sense, conjure animals
1/day each: dominate beast, invisibility

trait.name: Weapon Attunement
text: Fyrs have an ability to attune themselves with any wood-handled weapon, so that they get a +1 attack bonus with such a weapon once they've handled for at least 10 minutes. This bonus is already included in the battleaxe attack line above.

action.name: Battleaxe
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Headbutt
text: Melee Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is knocked prone, the fyr can make an immediate battleaxe attack against it as a bonus action.

monster.spells: animal friendship, speak with animals, faerie fire, pass without trace, beast sense, conjure animals, dominate beast, invisibility

monster.name: Gray Nisp

trait.name: Keen Scent
text: A gray nisp can taste blood in the surrounding water from a distance of up to 1 mile.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A gray nisp's inante spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4to hit with spell attacks). The gray nisp doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: confusion, detect thoughts, minor illusion (auditory only), hold monster, slow

trait.name: Water Dependent
text: A gray nisp can survive out of water for only 10 minutes. After that, it begins suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A gray nisp bites once and attacks twice with claws.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage. If both claws hit the same target, it takes an additional 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.spells: confusion, detect thoughts, minor illusion, hold monster, slow

monster.name: Grimm
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonsilver or nongood weapons
monster.languages: Understands Common and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Evil
text: A grimm constantly exudes a miasma of evil around itself. Any creature that begins its turn within 5 feet of a grimm takes 2d6 radiant damage. Creatures of evil alignment are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Diehard
text: A grimm does not die when it reaches 0 hit points. Instead, the creature continues fighting, but it must make a Constitution saving throw every time it takes damage while at 0 hit points. The DC of the saving throw equals the damage from the attack. The first time the grimm fails this saving throw, it gains tactical disadvantage on all its attack rolls and ability checks, but it keeps fighting. When it fails this saving throw for a second time, it dies instantly.

trait.name: Devour
text: If both of a grimm's claw attacks and its bite attack hit the same target in a single turn, the grimm gains temporary hit points equal to the piercing damage done by its bite. Ethereal Jaunt (recharge 5, 6). A grimm can shift between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane as a bonus action when it moves. It can remain on the Ethereal Plane only until ethereal jaunt recharges; it must return to the Material Plane on the first turn it can (but not necessarily as the first thing it does that turn; the grimm could move in the Ethereal Plane before returning to the Material Plane). While in the Ethereal Plane, the grimm can't be seen or harmed by anyone on the Material Plane except by magical effects that cross the planar boundary. It can see and hear what is around it (within 60 feet) on the Material Plane, but it can't harm anything in the Material Plane. While Ethereal, the grimm can move in any direction, even up or down and through solid objects, but it treats all space as difficult terrain.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A grimm's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The grimm doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: blur
3/day each: call lightning, darkness, detect fey (as detect evil and good but detects fey only)

action.name: Multiattack
text: A grimm attacks twice with its claws, then bites once.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage. If both claw attacks hit the same target, the grimm gains tactical advantage on its bite attack if it makes that attack immediately against the same target.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage. Also see devour, above.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt (Recharge 5-6)
text: See entry in traits.

monster.spells: blur, call lightning, darkness, detect evil and good

monster.name: Korred
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Animated Hair
text: A korred carries cuttings of its own hair, braided into ropes, in its leather pouch. It can quickly splice these short hair ropes into a longer rope and magically animate it to entangle foes. The time it takes to weave together enough rope for the job depends on the size of the creature to be entangled, as shown below. A korred's animated hair rope has AC 14, 8 hp, is immune to all but slashing damage, and flies with a speed of 30 feet. When it attacks its target, the target creature must make a successful DC 12 Dexterity or Strength saving throw or be restrained. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. The hair rope is destroyed by a successful Str saving throw, but a successful Dex save leaves it unaffected and it continues attacking. (Target Size, Time to Create, Duration) (Up to Tiny, 1 round, 9 rounds) (Small or Medium, 2 rounds, 6 rounds) (Large, 3 rounds, 3 rounds)

trait.name: Mobility
text: An opponent has tactical disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against a korred.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: Korred's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). A korred doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: animate objects (stones only), shatter, speak with stone (functions identically to speak with plants, but with stones instead), stone shape

trait.name: Stone Stride
text: A korred can step into a stone and emerge from any other stone within 30 feet as part of normal movement. The stones must be at least as large as the korred. It can't end its turn inside a stone.

action.name: Club
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shears
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage. A korred scores a critical hit with shears if its attack roll is a natural 18, 19, or 20.

action.name: Stone
text: Ranged Attack: +4 to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Laugh (Recharge 5-6)
text: Area Attack: automatic hit, range 60 ft., all creatures in range. Hit: creatures in range that can hear the laugh must make a successful DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for 1d3 rounds.

monster.spells: animate objects, shatter, speak with plants, stone shape

trait.name: Divination
text: The peddler provides good advice or a correct answer to one question asked of him by a creature who buys something from his cart. This ability functions similarly to a divination spell.

trait.name: Plane Shift
text: The midnight peddler can use the plane shift spell at will. He can shift only himself, his cart, and the nonliving contents of his cart; he can't bring along willing companions or banish other creatures.

action.name: Deathly Touch
text: Melee Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) necrotic damage. The target's maximum number of hit points is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage, and the midnight peddler gains the same number of temporary hit points.

monster.name: Mite

trait.name: Hatred
text: Mites have tactical advantage on attack rolls against dwarves, gnomes, and svirfneblin.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A mite's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 10). The mite doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: prestidigitation
1/day: fear

trait.name: Vermin Empathy (1/day)
text: As an action, a mite can summon a swarm of bats, a swarm of rats, 1d4 giant centipedes, 1d4 giant wasps, or 1d2 giant wolf spiders. The summoned creatures arrive 1d4 rounds after being summoned and stays near the mite for one hour. The mite has telepathic communication with the creatures and can give them simple commands such as "attack" and "enter that building."

action.name: Dagger
text: Melee Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
text: Ranged Attack: +3 to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.spells: prestidigitation, fear

monster.name: Pestie Mite

trait.name: Combat Mobility
text: Opportunity attacks against a moving pestie always have tactical disadvantage.

trait.name: Hatred
text: Pesties have tactical advantage on attack rolls against dwarves, gnomes, and svirfneblin.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
text: A pestie's dagger attack does an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the pestie has advantage on the attack or if one of its allies is within 5 feet of the target.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A pestie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 10). The pestie doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: prestidigitation
1/day: fear

action.name: Dagger
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
text: Ranged Attack: +4 to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: prestidigitation, fear

monster.name: Pech
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Earthbound
text: A pech has tactical disadvantage on attack rolls against targets that are entirely surrounded by an element other than earth; i.e., foes that are flying or swimming.

trait.name: Light Blindness
text: A pech has tactical disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks in bright light.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A pech's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The pech doesn't need material components to use these abilities.

4/day: stone shape, speak with stone (functions identically to speak with plants, but with stones instead) A pech can also use the following spell-like abilities as part of a group. All members of the group must be within 20 feet of all other members of the group, and all must use an action simultaneously to trigger the spell-like effect. An individual pech can use each ability once per day. Only one pech needs to maintain concentration to keep an effect ongoing.
4 pechs: wall of stone
8 pechs: greater restoration (only to remove petrification)

trait.name: Stone Knowledge
text: A pech's extensive knowledge of stone gives it tactical advantage on attack rolls against creatures made of stone, earth, or clay.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A pech attacks twice with its pick or twice with stones, or uses one spell-like ability.

action.name: Pick
text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Stone
text: Ranged Attack: +3 to hit, range 30 ft./90 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: stone shape, speak with plants, wall of stone greater restoration

monster.name: Chaos Knight
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical waepons

trait.name: Icy Incorporeality
text: By using an action, a chaos knight can make itself incorporeal until the start of its next turn. While incorporeal, it can pass through solid objects such as a wall, or other creatures, as if they were difficult terrain. It leaves behind an icy outline where it passes.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: The chaos knight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The chaos knight doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At-Will: chill touch, ray of frost
3/day: dimension door, protection from good
2/day: ice storm
1/day: telekinesis, wall of ice

action.name: Multiattack
text: The chaos knight attacks twice with its greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 1d6 cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, ray of frost, dimension door, protection from good, ice storm, telekinesis, wall of ice

monster.name: Dagon
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, all damage not inflicted by good-aligned attackers or good-aligned weapons
monster.immune: lightning, poison, all damage from water-based or water-effecting spells
monster.languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Giant, Infernal, telepathy to 100 ft.

trait.name: Deadly Critical
text: Dagon scores a critical hit whenever its attack roll is a natural 19 or 20. A creature struck by a critical hit from Dagon is also poisoned for one minute and must make a successful DC 20 Constitution saving throw or immediately begin drowning. This affects all creatures, even those that can ordinarily breathe underwater or are benefiting from a water breathing spell or similar magic. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; drowning ceases with a successful save. Drowning continues until a successful save is made, the target dies, or the effect is dispelled as a 7th-level spell. A successful saving throw does not make the target immune to this effect from another critical hit.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
text: Dagon can opt to automatically succeed on a saving throw it just failed.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: Dagon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Dagon doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
Constant: speak with animals (aquatic animals only)

At will: cloudkill (works underwater only), dominate monster, darkness, detect evil and good, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fear, magic missile (6 missiles), teleport, telekinesis, tongues, water breathing
3/day each: blur, conjure elemental (water only), enhance ability
1/day each: confusion, feeblemind, finger of death, hold person, hold monster, lightning bolt, stoneskin, time stop, web, wish

trait.name: Unholy Aura
text: An unholy aura surrounds Dagon to a radius of 40 feet. All creatures must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw with the effects shown below. Evil creatures have tactical advantage on the saving throw. (Most evil creatures know better than to approach within 40 feet of Dagon.)
Level or CR Successful Save Failed Save
25 No ill effect Stunned 1 round
21-24 Frightened 1d4 rounds Stunned 1 round, then frightened 2d4 rounds
16-20 Paralyzed 1d6 rounds, then frightened 1d4 rounds Paralyzed 1d10 minutes, then frightened 2d4 rounds
0-15 Paralyzed 1d10 minutes, then frightened 2d4 rounds Instant death

trait.name: Water Mastery
text: Dagon always has tactical advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws when he is even partly in sea water.

action.name: Multiattack
text: Dagon attacks once with its trident and twice with its claws.

action.name: Trident
text: Melee Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) slashing damage and the target is poisoned.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
text: Dagon attacks once with a claw.

legendary.name: Spell-like Ability
text: Dagon uses one of its at-will spell-like abilities.

legendary.name: Trident Attack
text: Dagon attacks once with its trident.

monster.spells: cloudkill, dominate monster, darkness, detect evil and good, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fear, magic missile, teleport, telekinesis, tongues, water breathing blur, conjure elemental, enhance ability confusion, feeblemind, finger of death, hold person, hold monster, lightning bolt, stoneskin, time stop, web, wish

monster.name: Teratashia, Demon Princess of Dimensions
monster.resist: acid, cold, psychic
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons, lightning, poison

trait.name: Regeneration
text: Teratashia regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she is in darkness. She regains 5 hit points if she is in dim light, and no hit points if she is in bright light.

trait.name: Light Avoidance
text: Teratashia's speed increases to 50 feet and her flying speed increases to 70 feet if she is in bright light at the start of her turn. Her speed returns to normal when she starts her turn in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: Teratashia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). She doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, fear, suggestion
3/day each: charm person, insect plague, telekinesis, wall of stone

trait.name: Teratashia's Necklace of Skulls
text: Teratashia's necklace is a powerful magic item. It is made from 13 skulls, and each skull has gems set into the eye sockets. Each gem stores one magic spell; the wearer of the necklace can use an action (or reaction for counterspell) to cast one of the spells. Spells are cast at their lowest level, using the caster's attack bonus and saving throw DC. The necklace recovers one expended charge per hour when worn by Teratashia; it doesn't recover charges when worn by anyone else. arcane lock (x2) bestow curse (x2) cloudkill (x2) cone of cold (x4) counterspell (x2) cure wounds (x4) fireball (x2) hypnotic pattern (x2) knock (x2) mirror image (x2) witch bolt (x2)

action.name: Multiattack
text: Teratashia attacks four times with her claws, or she attacks twice with claws and either uses one spell-like ability or one charge from her necklace.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) lightning damage.

monster.spells: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, fear, suggestion, charm person, insect plague, telekinesis, wall of stone

monster.name: Demonic Knight
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Create Spawn
text: Any humanoid slain by a demonic knight's breath of unlife returns to life in 2d4 rounds as a shadow demon under the command of the demonic knight that created it. The new shadow demon remains enslaved to the demonic knight until the knight's death. They do not retain any of the abilities they had in life.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: The demonic knight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The demonic knight doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: detect magic, see invisibility, wall of ice
2/day each: dispel magic, symbol
1/day each: fireball, power word stun

trait.name: Summon Demonic Aid (1/day)
text: Once per day as an action, a demonic knight can summon additional demons to his side. He can summon 1d4 shadow demons, 2 glabrezus or hezrous, or 1 vrock or marilith. To complete the summoning, the demonic knight must make a successful DC 18 Cha check (normally a 50% chance). The summoned demons teleport into empty spaces within 60 feet of the demon knight, of his choosing, and remain until they're slain or for one hour.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A demonic knight attacks once with its anarchic longsword and once with either its breath of unlife or its fist.

action.name: Anarchic Longsword
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) slashing, magic damage (treat as magic damage).

action.name: Mailed Fist
text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath of Unlife (Recharge 5-6)
text: Ranged Attack: automatic hit, range 10 ft. cone, creatures in the cone. Hit: 33 (6d10) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful DC 15 Constitution saving throw. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this attack dies instantly; see Create Spawn above.

monster.spells: detect magic, see invisibility, wall of ice, dispel magic, symbol, fireball, power word stun

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage and the target must make a successful DC 11 Constitution saving throw against poison or be paralyzed for 1d6 rounds. A paralyzed creature takes 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of its turns while it is paralyzed.

monster.name: Hawanar Genie

trait.name: Air Mastery
text: Airborne creatures have tactical disadvantage on attacks against a hawanar.

trait.name: Holocone
text: A hawanar can transform into a vortex of embers and white-hot fire as a bonus action and can remain in this form for up to six rounds. Once it changes back to its normal form, it can't resume its holocone form for another 10 minutes. In holocone form, the hawanar genie can move through the air or along any surface at its fly speed. It can move through spaces occupied by other creatures; creatures of Medium size or smaller must make a successful DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be swept into the vortex, taking 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage and being grappled by the genie, which can then move the grappled creature according to the normal grappling rules. The genie can't end its move in the same space as a character it isn't grappling.

trait.name: Mobility
text: When a hawanar genie moves, opportunity attacks against it have tactical disadvantage

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: A hawanar genie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5to hit with spell attacks). The genie doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At will: plane shift (willing targets to elemental planes, Astral Plane, or Material Plane only)

1/day each: burning hands, create wine and water (as create food and water, but creates wine instead of water), fireball, gaseous form, invisibility (self only), major image, scorching ray (3 rays), wall of fire, wind walk

action.name: Multiattack
text: A hawanar genie attacks twice with fists or twice with its falchion, or uses a spelllike ability.

action.name: Fist
text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

action.name: Falchion
text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the hawanar's attack roll is a natural 18, 19, or 20.

monster.spells: plane shift, burning hands, create food and water, fireball, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, scorching ray, wall of fire, wind walk

monster.name: Giant Slug of P'nakh
monster.resist: piercing, slashing, acid

trait.name: Smothering
text: When a giant slug of P'nahk hits a creature with its crushing attack, it drops its body onto the creature, pinning it to the ground. Treat this as being grappled and restrained, but the creature must also make an immediate DC 14 Constitution saving throw. A successful saving throw indicates the creature inhaled a lungful of air before being trapped; a failed saving throw indicates the air was forced from the creature's lungs and it is suffocating. A suffocating creature can act normally for a number of rounds equal to its Con modifier (minimum of 1 round). Once those rounds expire, the creature drops to 0 hit points at the start of its next turn and it must make death saving throws.

trait.name: Insanity of P'nahk
text: A giant P'Nahki slug can produce a momentary mental blast that transmits subliminal images of the nightmarish realm of P'nahk. All creatures in the affected area that fail a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw recall these images and must roll 1d4 to determine how they are affected (see below). In addition, affected characters repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns; the effect ends with a successful save (indicating the character managed to forget the images). Characters with Int scores of 16 or higher are peculiarly vulnerable to this attack; they make the saving throws with tactical disadvantage.
1d4 for Effect
1--Paralyzed; the character strikes back instinctively with a melee attack or a cantrip (as a reaction) against anything that attacks him or her, but can take no other action and can't move.
2--Paranoid rage; the character attacks its nearest allies.
3--Self loathing; the character drops any held items and claws at his or her body, inflicting 1d4 slashing damage per round.
4--Awe of P'nahk; the character drops all held items, falls prone, and grovels in worship of the slug and all things P'nahki. The character is paralyzed.

trait.name: Telepathy
text: Giant slugs of P'nahk are telepathic, so they can communicate with all creatures within 100 feet.

trait.name: Transparency
text: Because of its transparent body, a giant slug of P'nahk always has tactical advantage on Stealth checks and it can attempt to hide anytime it is lightly obscured, such as when it is in dim light.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A giant slug of P'nahk bites once and crushes once, or uses its mind blast.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Crush
text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked prone, grappled, restrained, and smothered (see above).

action.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 6)
text: Area Attack: automatic hit, range 60 ft. cone, creatures in cone. Hit: every creature in the affected area must make a successful DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or be affected by the insanity of P'nahk (see above). Characters with Int 16 or higher have tactical disadvantage on the saving throw.

trait.name: Earth Glide
text: A khargra can glide through stone, dirt, and almost any other sort of earth, including metal, as easily as a fish swims through water. Its burrowing leaves behind no tunnel or hole and does not create a ripple or other sign of its presence. A move earth spell cast on an area containing a burrowing khargra flings the khargra back 30 feet and stuns the creature for 1 round unless it makes a successful Constitution saving throw.

trait.name: Metal Attunement
text: A khargra has tactical advantage on attack rolls against targets wearing metal armor (chain shirt or better) or carrying a metal shield.

trait.name: Vulnerable to Heat
text: A khargra takes maximum damage from a heat metal spell.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A khargra attacks once with claws and bites once.

action.name: Claws
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage and the target is grappled. If the target is using a shield, it is not grappled but it must make a successful DC 12 Strength saving throw or the khargra pulls the shield away and drops it.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, plus 4 (1d8) fire damage if the target is grappled by the khargra.

monster.name: Kurok-spirit
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical or nonsilver weapons

trait.name: Ghost Flames
text: Every creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of a kurok-spirit must make a successful DC 11 Constitution saving throw or take 2 (1d4) necrotic damage. The creature's maximum number of hit points is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage, and the kurok-spirit gains the same number of temporary hit points.

trait.name: Incorporeal
text: A kurok-spirit can move through solid objects and other creatures as if they were difficult terrain. The kurok-spirit takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it is still inside something solid at the end of its turn.

trait.name: Soul Eater
text: A creature slain by a kurok-spirit can't be raised from the dead; its soul was devoured by the kurok-spirit and no longer exists.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) necrotic damage and the target must make a successful DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or take 6 (1d6 + 3) psychic damage.

trait.name: Scream
text: A screaming devilkin continuously emits a painful howl. Creatures with hearing must make a successful DC 11 Constitution saving throw every time they start their turn within 60 feet of a screaming devilkin or be incapacitated and deafened until the start of their next turn. It doesnt matter how many screaming devilkin are within range; only one saving throw needs to be made each round. A silence spell can negate devilkin screaming for the duration of the spell.

action.name: Tail Barb
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Shadow Mastiff
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Frightful Howl
text: As an action, a shadow mastiff can emit a terrifying, otherworldly howl that conjures nightmare visions in those who hear it. All living creatures within 300 feet of the shadow mastiff that hear its howl must make a successful DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 3d6 rounds. While frightened, the creature must move away from the shadow mastiff as rapidly as possible, until its far enough away that it cant hear the howling at all (not just beyond the howls effective 300-foot range).

trait.name: Shadow Affinity
text: A shadow mastiff has tactical advantage on Dex (Stealth) checks in dim light or darkness, and it can make a Stealth check to become hidden as a bonus action anytime it is in darkness or dim light. A shadow mastiff suffers the effect of being poisoned while in bright light.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Thalasskoptis, Demon Prince
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: Thalasskoptis's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). Thalasskoptis doesn't need material components to use these abilities.
At Will: animate dead, charm person, clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fear, suggestion, teleport
3/Day: dominate monster

trait.name: Toxic Ink (3/day)
text: Thalasskoptis can squirt a cloud of poisonous ink into air or water. The ink creates a sphere 60 feet in radius centered on Thalasskoptis, and it lasts for one minute. The cloud is stationary; it doesn't move with Thalasskoptis. The area inside the cloud is heavily obscured. Creatures other than Thalasskoptis in the ink cloud must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw against poison or be stunned for as long as they remain inside the ink cloud.

action.name: Multiattack
text: Thalasskoptis attacks four times with tentacles, or it attacks twice with tentacles and either uses one spelllike ability or emits a toxic ink cloud.

action.name: Tentacles
text: Melee Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target of this attack is a stunned creature, the attack is automatically a critical hit.

legendary.name: Bite
text: +8 to hit, one creature grappled by Thalasskoptis. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage and the target must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1d6 rounds and take 9 (2d8) poison damage.

legendary.name: Spell-Like Ability
text: Thalasskoptis uses one at-will spell-like ability.

legendary.name: Tentacle Grab
text: Thalasskoptis makes one tentacle attack. If this attack hits, the target is also grappled.

monster.spells: animate dead, charm person, clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fear, suggestion, teleport, dominate monster

trait.name: Rock Thrower
text: A biclops without spears can throw boulders, tables, or any other large objects instead, with the same attack and damage statistics as its spear attack.

trait.name: Two Heads
text: A biclops has tactical advantage on Wis and Int saving throws and on saving throws against being charmed, deafened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Wakeful
text: A biclops never falls fully asleep; one head always remains awake while the other sleeps.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A biclops attacks twice with its longsword or twice with spears.

action.name: Longsword
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Two-Headed Action (Recharge 4-6)
text: After taking its normal action, a biclops can use a bonus action to attack (attacking twice, as normal), move, or search.

trait.name: Pound
text: A jack-in-irons that grapples an opponent of Medium size or smaller can smash the opponent into the ground or any other nearby solid object as an attack. This attack hits automatically and does 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and the creature must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the start of the giant's next turn.

trait.name: Shake the Earth
text: As an action, a jack-inirons can stomp its foot on the ground, causing powerful vibrations to radiate out around the giant. Any creature within 10 feet of the jack-in-irons must make a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A jack-inirons giant makes two melee attacks in any combination of club, chain, fist, and pound, or it makes two ranged attacks, or it shakes the earth (see above).

action.name: Club
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful DC 17 Strength saving throw or be incapacitated until the start of the giant's next turn.

action.name: Chain
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled and restrained until the start of the giant's next turn.

action.name: Fist
text: Melee Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Rock
text: Ranged Attack: +9 to hit, range 60 ft./240 ft., one creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
text: A two-headed troll regains 5 hit points at the start of each of its turns. This ability doesnt function if the troll took fire damage since its previous turn. To be killed, the troll must be prevented from regenerating for at least one round while it has 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A two-headed troll attacks twice with claws or weapons and bites twice.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

trait.name: Death Throes
text: When a dark creeper is slain, its body combusts in a flash of bright light, leaving its gear in a heap on the ground. All creatures within 10 feet of the slain creeper must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1d6 rounds. Other dark creepers within 10 feet fail the saving throw automatically.

trait.name: Poison
text: Dark creepers are skilled in the use of poison. They favor a foul-smelling, dark paste called black smear that they distill from fungi that grows only in deep caverns. Creatures poisoned by black smear take 2 (1d4) poison damage immediately and suffer the usual effect of the poisoned condition. Poisoned creatures repeat the DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On a successful save, they are no longer poisoned; on a failed save, they take 2 (1d4) poison damage and the poisoned condition continues. Each dark creeper carries three doses of this poison, and they train from childhood to reapply it to their daggers as a bonus action after a successful hit.

trait.name: Rag Armor
text: A dark creeper's multiple layers of filthy rags function as hide armor when worn by one of their kind.

trait.name: See in Darkness
text: Light conditions are reversed in effect for dark creepers. They treat complete darkness as bright light and bright light as complete darkness. A dark creeper sees perfectly in darkness of any kind, including magical darkness.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
text: A dark creeper's dagger attack does an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the dark creeper has advantage on the attack or if another dark creeper or dark stalker is within 5 feet of the target.

action.name: Dagger
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage and the target must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned (see below).

monster.name: Dark Stalker

trait.name: Death Throes
text: When a dark stalker is slain, its body combusts in a flash of flame. All creatures within 20 feet of the slain stalker must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage, or half damage with a successful save. The stalker's combustible gear is burned to ash, but other items (shortswords, poison vials, coins, gems) survive the burst of fire.

trait.name: Poison
text: Dark stalkers are skilled in the use of poison. They favor a foul-smelling, dark paste called black smear that they distill from fungi that grows only in deep caverns. Creatures poisoned by black smear take 2 (1d4) poison damage immediately and suffer the usual effect of the poisoned condition. In addition, they must repeat the DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On a successful save, they are no longer poisoned; on a failed save, they take 1d4 poison damage and the poisoned condition continues. Each dark stalker carries six doses of this poison, and they train from childhood to reapply it to their shortswords as a bonus action after a successful hit.

trait.name: See in Darkness
text: Light conditions are reversed in effect for dark stalkers. They treat complete darkness as bright light and bright light as complete darkness. A dark stalker sees perfectly in darkness of any kind, including magical darkness.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
text: A dark stalker's shortsword attack does an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the dark stalker has advantage on the attack or if another dark stalker or dark creeper is within 5 feet of the target.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: Dark stalkers' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). Dark stalkers don't need material components to use these abilities.
At will: darkness, detect magic, fog cloud

action.name: Multiattack
text: A dark stalker attacks twice with shortswords.

action.name: Shortsword
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage and the target must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned (see below).

monster.spells: darkness, detect magic, fog cloud

trait.name: Grippli Shaman
text: Any large group of gripplis (12 or more) will be accompanied by one or more tribal shamans.

trait.name: Grippli Poison
text: A target hit by a poisoned grippli dart must make a successful DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1d4 rounds. At the end of the last turn of poisoning, the target repeats the saving throw. A successful save means the target recovers, but a failed save means the target becomes paralyzed for 1d6 rounds. A successful saving throw does not make the target immune to later poisonings.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
text: Gripplis can move across mud, muck, shallow water, and any other difficult terrain that arises from the presence of water without penalty.

action.name: Shortsword
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
text: Ranged Attack: +5 to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If poison is used, see grippli poison, above.

action.name: Net
text: Ranged Attack: +5 to hit, range 5 ft./15 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained until it makes a successful DC 10 Strength check or until 5 slashing damage is done to the net (AC 10). Targets of Huge size or larger are not affected.

monster.name: Grippli Shaman

trait.name: Grippli Shaman
text: Any large group of gripplis (12 or more) will be accompanied by one or more tribal shamans. A grippli shaman has heightened Wisdom (13).

trait.name: Spellcasting
text: A Grippli Shaman's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It doesn't need material components to cast these spells.
Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance
1st level (x4): animal friendship, entangle, fog cloud, goodberry
2nd level (x2): lesser restoration, pass without trace

trait.name: Grippli Poison
text: A target hit by a poisoned grippli dart must make a successful DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1d4 rounds. At the end of the last turn of poisoning, the target repeats the saving throw. A successful save means the target recovers, but a failed save means the target becomes paralyzed for 1d6 rounds. A successful saving throw does not make the target immune to later poisonings.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
text: Gripplis can move across mud, muck, shallow water, and any other difficult terrain that arises from the presence of water without penalty.

action.name: Shortsword
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
text: Ranged Attack: +5 to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If poison is used, see grippli poison, above.

action.name: Net
text: Ranged Attack: +5 to hit, range 5 ft./15 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained until it makes a successful DC 10 Strength check or until 5 slashing damage is done to the net (AC 10). Targets of Huge size or larger are not affected.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, animal friendship, entangle, fog cloud, goodberry, lesser restoration, pass without trace

trait.name: Confusion Aura (1/ day)
text: When three huggermuggers gather in a group, they automatically generate an aura of confusion. All creatures within 40 feet of any one of the huggermuggers must make a successful DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be affected the same as if by a confusion spell for 1d6 rounds. Each of the huggermuggers generating the effect must be no more than 30 feet from both of the other two; if one of them moves outside that range or is killed, incapacitated, or knocked unconscious, the aura and the effect end immediately. If another huggermugger is within range of the other two, however, it can instantly assume the fallen huggermugger's role in maintaining the confusion aura, so there is no break in the aura's effect. An individual huggermugger can contribute to creating one confusion aura per day. A creature that successfully saves against the aura is immune to all huggermugger confusion auras until the end of their next long rest.

trait.name: Cunning
text: Huggermuggers possess cunning and logical ability far beyond what their nominal Intelligence and Wisdom scores imply. They never lose their bearings in any setting, they are never surprised, and they can automatically follow any trail that's less than 24 hours old. They have tactical advantage on Wis (Survival) checks to follow a trail that's more than 24 hours old.

action.name: Shortsword
text: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
text: Ranged Attack: +5 to hit, range 30 ft./120 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Elemental Vulnerability
text: Lava children take 1 extra damage per damage die from spells of the tempest domain. They are unaffected (either directly or indirectly) by spells of the transmutation school.

trait.name: Metal Immunity
text: Lava children are completely unaffected by metal. They can walk through metal doors or bars as if the metal wasn't there, and metal objects and weapons, including magic weapons, pass right through a lava child's body without affecting it in any way. Because of this, a lava child also has tactical advantage on melee attack rolls against targets wearing armor that is predominantly metal.

trait.name: Lava Child Shaman
text: Every band of lava children includes one arcane spellcaster.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A lava child bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Claws
text: Melee Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage. If the lava child bites the same creature that it hit with its claws this turn, its bite does an additional 4 (1d8) fire damage.

monster.name: Lava Child Shaman

trait.name: Elemental Vulnerability
text: Lava children take 1 extra damage per damage die from spells of the tempest domain. They are unaffected (either directly or indirectly) by spells of the transmutation school.

They can walk through metal doors or bars as if the metal wasn't there, and metal objects and weapons, including magic weapons, pass right through a lava child's body without affecting it in any way. Because of this, a lava child also has tactical advantage on melee attack rolls against targets wearing armor that is predominantly metal.

trait.name: Spellcasting
text: A lava child shaman's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It doesn't need material components to cast these spells. The shaman is CR 1 (200 XP).
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, dancing lights
1st level (x4): burning hands, comprehend languages, magic missile
2nd level (x2): continual flame, scorching ray

monster.spells: fire bolt, dancing lights, burning hands, comprehend languages, magic missile, continual flame, scorching ray

trait.name: Rage
text: When a ryven is reduced to 12 or fewer hit points in combat, it flies into a berserk rage lasting ten rounds (one minute). While berserk, the ryven has tactical advantage on bite attacks, it uses both its bite and claw attacks, all of its attacks do 2 extra points of damage, and it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It drops whatever it held in its hands and fights solely with tooth and claw. Ryven shamans are immune to rage.

trait.name: Ryven Shaman
text: Any large group of ryvens (seven or more) will be accompanied by one or more tribal shamans.

trait.name: White and Black Death
text: Some ryven (approximately 1 in 5) coat their weapons and claws with a poison known as the white and black death. A living creature struck by a poisoned weapon or claw must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage immediately and be poisoned for 1d6 rounds.

action.name: Multiattack
text: A ryven normally makes one melee attack or one ranged attack. When berserk, it bites once and attacks once with claws.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage; also see White and Black Death, above.

action.name: Shortsword
text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage; also see White and Black Death, above.

action.name: Light Crossbow
text: Ranged Attack: +4 to hit, range 80 ft./320 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage; also see White and Black Death, above.

While berserk, the ryven has tactical advantage on bite attacks, it uses both its bite and claw attacks, all of its attacks do 2 extra points of damage, and it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It drops whatever it held in its hands and fights solely with tooth and claw. Ryven shamans are immune to rage.

text: A ryven shaman's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It doesnt need material components to cast these spells. The listed spells are suggestions only; others can be chosen instead. Ryven shamans are immune to rage.

2nd level (x2): beast sense, moonbeam
